summary: This document is an internal FBI email chain discussing the potential nomination of the Epstein/Maxwell investigation for the Attorney General's Awards. FBI personnel from the New York Field Office and Victim Services Division consider submitting the investigation for recognition, questioning if the investigation needs to be resolved first and if the Southern District of New York (SDNY) would approve.

persons.name: Special Agent - FBI New York Field Office
persons.context: Responds to an email about nominating the Epstein/Maxwell investigation for an award, questioning if the investigation needs to be resolved before submission.

persons.name: Program Manager FBI Victim Services Division
persons.context: Forwards an award nomination announcement and asks colleagues for their thoughts on submitting the Epstein/Maxwell investigation, inquiring if SDNY would be okay with it.

events.title: Discussion of Award Nomination for Epstein/Maxwell Investigation
events.description: FBI personnel discuss nominating the Epstein/Maxwell investigation for the Attorney General's Awards, questioning procedural details.
personsInvolved: Special Agent - FBI New York Field Office
Program Manager FBI Victim Services Division

events.title: Deadline for Attorney General's Award Nominations
events.description: Nominations for the 69th annual Attorney General's Awards must be submitted by this date.

keyFacts: FBI personnel internally discussed nominating the Epstein/Maxwell investigation for the Attorney General's Awards in February 2021.
A question was raised about whether the investigation needed to be resolved before it could be submitted for an award.
The email indicates ongoing coordination and recognition efforts within the FBI regarding the high-profile investigation.
